intro: Nothaphoebe archboldiana, commonly known as the Archbold's nothaphoebe, is a rare evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, while its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
